In the event the following guidelines conflict with the UGC Policy, the terms of the UGC Policy will prevail. Be Original • You may only upload and share content that is your own work. • You may not use logos or trademarks belonging to someone else in your work. • Although some content you may find on the Internet has been designated as available for use in "derivative works" or "for personal use," or "use for nonprofit purposes," you may not use this content in your UGC for MapleStory 2 or any Nexon service. UGC submitted or uploaded to MapleStory 2 does not qualify as personal or non-profit use. • Do not upload or share the designs or logos of others—even if you have modified the design or logo. • While it is fine to be inspired by existing work created by other users, it is not okay to copy someone else's work. Create your own UGC. Be original. • You may not describe or tag your UGC with words or language that identifies it as a specific character, trademark or brand name. Be Respectful • You may not use images of real people—even if the images are of yourself, your friends or famous people—for any UGC including Outfits and other items, Displays, Guild Emblems, Housing or Character Portraits. • You may not upload or share any content that is offensive, suggestive, harassing, abusive, degrading, hateful, political, religious or violent.

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Using the Wardrobe</FONT>
<FONT size='3'> </FONT>
The wardrobe allows you to save gear or outfit sets and instantly switch between them. Simply set the tab type to either "Gear" or "Outift" and hit the "Save" button to save your currently equipped gear or outfits. You can equip wardrobe sets more quickly by assigning them to hotkeys! 
The wardrobe is unavailable while in combat. If you no longer possess an item or meet the requirements to equip it, that item will be ignored when equipping a set. If you don't see an equipped item displayed on your character, check the settings of your Transparency Badge.

<FONT color='#FFD200'>Bonus Dungeon Reward Vouchers</FONT> can be used from your inventory to increase dungeon rewards.
Each dungeon requires a different number of vouchers to add rewards. The number also depends on how many rewards have been added.
When the added rewards reset, the voucher requirements also reset.

Other vouchers listed below can also be used to add rewards.
- 3 rewards per day dungeon: 1 <FONT color='#FFD200'>Bonus Dungeon Reward Voucher</FONT>
- 5 rewards per week dungeon: 1 <FONT color='#FFD200'>Fantastic Bonus Dungeon Reward Voucher</FONT>
- 1 reward per week dungeon: 1 <FONT color='#FFD200'>Superior Bonus Dungeon Reward Voucher</FONT>

Remember that any vouchers not used by the reset will be lost.

<FONT size='3'> </FONT>
In order to enchant Epic quality items or better beyond <FONT color='#00A2ED'>+10</FONT>, you must sacrifice copies of that item. (These items don't need to be enchanted themselves.)

If you use more than the required number of catalysts, you can increase your enchant success chance up to <FONT color='#00A2ED'>30%</FONT>.

Once you've selected an item to enchant, available catalysts will appear here. <FONT color='#00A2ED'>Locked</FONT> and <FONT color='#00A2ED'>equipped</FONT> items cannot be used as a catalyst.

Locked Item Restrictions:
- Cannot be traded
- Cannot be sold on the Black Market
- Cannot be sold to merchants
- Cannot be dropped or destroyed
- Cannot be dismantled
\n- Can have its bonus attributes edited
\n- Can have its sockets unlocked, and gems may be equipped to or removed from it

Locked Item Privileges:
- Can be equipped and unequipped
- Can be placed in storage or on mannequins
- Can be enchanted

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Star Points</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nUsed in the Star Shop.

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Mentee Points</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nEarn Mentee Points by logging in daily, completing mentee missions, and clearing dungeons. Can be used at the Mentee Shop.

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Mentor Points</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nEarn Mentor Points by clearing dungeons with your mentee. Clearing dungeons with a normal returning user also grants a small amount of Mentor Points. Can be used at the Mentor Shop.

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Havi Fruit</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nEarned by setting new records in Dark Descent. Trade havi fruit to Puri the Havi Collector at the Stonehill Dig Site.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Rue</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nEarned from daily quests offered by the Allicari merchants. Used to buy special items from the Allicari merchants in Queenstown.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Treva</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nEarned in the Twisted Pocket Realm. Used to buy special items from shadow merchants.

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Valor Token</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nEarned by competing in the Maple Arena and PvP events. Spend Valor Tokens at the Arena Shop in the Maple Arena. Valor Tokens may be reset at an announced date.

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Budget Settings</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nSet aside funds for your friends to furnish your house with. Others can only spend as much as you set aside when furnishing your house. This limit does not apply to you.

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >My Home Settings</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nAdjust settings that affect your whole house, including activity permissions, camera, lighting, and background options.

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >List</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nList the item in the Design Shop.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Remove Listing</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nRemoved and expired listings do not show up for sale in the Design Shop, but they can be relisted at any time.

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Remove Item</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nIf you remove the item from your shop, you will need to list it as a new item in order to sell it again. This will reset any information associated with the listing, including sales records.

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Relist</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nPut an item whose listing has expired back on to the marketplace. Items that are not listed for sale will not be displayed in the Design Shop. The first time re-listing each item is free.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Relist</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nRelist the item in the Design Shop. The item's sale records, price, and original listing date will be preserved.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Hide Pre-existing Designs</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nHides any designs that are already in your shop (including expired listings).
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Sale Duration</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nWhen the sale duration ends, your listed item will be removed from the Design Shop.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Listing Fee</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nThe fee varies depending on the number of currently listed items.

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Promote Item</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nOne of your promoted items will be chosen at random to be featured under the "Promoted Items" section of the Meret Market's Design Shop.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Tags</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nAdd search keywords to help players find your item.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Item Description</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nAdd a description for your item listing! This description will only be displayed within the meret market.

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Sale Price</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nEnter the price per unit for your item. When the item is sold, handling fees will be deducted from this price. Fees are rounded up to the nearest whole number. You can check your total earnings under the My Shop tab.

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Become a Dungeon Veteran</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nYou've run enough dungeons to become a dungeon veteran. If you help dungeon rookies clear dungeons, you'll get a little something extra for your time! Click the button to become a dungeon veteran.

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Request Help</FONT>
<FONT size='3'> </FONT>
You can request the help of a strong adventurer familiar with this dungeon.
Click the button to send a public request for help!

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Qualifications for Helping</FONT>
<FONT size='3'> </FONT>
To respond to a call for assistance with this dungeon, you must have cleared it at least ten times. After reaching Lv. 50, you are immediately qualified to assist with Adventure dungeons below Lv. 50.

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Coins Collected</FONT>
<FONT size='3'> </FONT>You can get Dungeon Helper Coins after clearing dungeons with rookies, regardless of the dungeon clear limit. These coins may be used at Spartan's shop in Queenstown.

You can get up to 10 Dungeon Helper Coins per day. This limit resets at midnight.
The current dungeon will be reset
Login rewards can be found in your mailbox.
Servants of the underworld... claim what is yours!
The world lies within my grasp!
You worthless insects! I'll crush you all!

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Enchantment Charges</FONT> 
<FONT size='3'> </FONT>
Each time you fail to enchant an item, that item will gain enchantment charges.
 - Failing +10: 1 Charge 
 - Failing +11: 2 Charges 
 - Failing +12: 3 Charges 
 - Failing +13: 4 Charges
 - Failing +14: 4 Charges
 - Failing +15: 5 Charges 
You can spend enchantment charges to increase the success chance of future enchantments up to <FONT color='#00A2ED'>100%</FONT>. 

<FONT color='#FF5F5F'>Spent enchantment charges will be consumed regardless of whether or not the enchant succeeds. </FONT>

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Catalysts</FONT>
<FONT size='3'> </FONT>
In order to enchant Epic quality items or better beyond <FONT color='#00A2ED'>+10</FONT>, you must sacrifice copies of that item. (These items don't need to be enchanted themselves.)

Once you've selected an item to enchant, available catalysts will appear here. <FONT color='#00A2ED'>Locked</FONT> and <FONT color='#00A2ED'>equipped</FONT> items cannot be used as a catalyst.

<FONT color='#FF5F5F'>Catalysts disappear after use.</FONT>
Please select an item to enchant.

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Dark Damage Reduction</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nReduces dark damage taken from enemies.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Poison Damage Reduction</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nReduces poison damage taken from enemies.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Electric Damage Reduction</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nReduces electric damage taken from enemies.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Ice Damage Reduction</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nReduces ice damage taken from enemies.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Fire Damage Reduction</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nReduces fire damage taken from enemies.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Ranged Damage Reduction</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nReduces the ranged damage taken from enemies.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Melee Reduction</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nReduces the melee damage taken from enemies.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Critical Evasion</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nDecreases the probability that an attack from an enemy will be a critical hit.

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Evasion</FONT>
<FONT size='3'> </FONT>
Increases the probability of dodging attacks from enemies.
Dodging an attack prevents all damage.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Magic Resistance</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nReduces magic damage taken from enemies.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Physical Resistance</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nReduces physical damage taken from enemies.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Defense</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nReduces damage taken from enemies.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >PvP Damage</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>Increases the damage dealt to other players.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Skill Cooldown Reduction</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nReduces the cooldown times of active skills.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Attack Speed</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>Increases attack speed.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Recovery Bonus</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nIncreases the amount recovered from skills which restore health or spirit.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Total Damage Bonus</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nIncreases the damage dealt to enemies.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Bonus Boss Damage</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nIncreases the damage dealt to boss monsters.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Holy Damage Bonus</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nIncreases the damage dealt with holy attacks.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Dark Damage Bonus</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nIncreases the damage dealt with dark attacks.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Poison Damage Bonus</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nIncreases the damage dealt with poison attacks.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Electric Damage Bonus</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nIncreases the damage dealt with electric attacks.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Ice Damage Bonus</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nIncreases the damage dealt with ice attacks.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Fire Damage Bonus</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nIncreases the damage dealt with fire attacks.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Ranged Damage Bonus</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nIncreases the damage dealt with ranged attacks.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Melee Damage Bonus</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nIncreases the damage dealt with melee attacks.

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Critical Damage</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nIncreases the damage dealt from critical hits. Critical damage cannot exceed 250% against regular enemies, and cannot exceed 150% against other player characters.

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Critical Rate</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nIncreases the probability that an attack will land as a critical hit. Critical hits deal additional damage. Critical rate cannot be increased beyond 40%.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Accuracy</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nIncreases the success rate of attacks.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Magic Piercing</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nIgnores a portion of the enemy's magic resistance when using magic attacks.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Physical Piercing</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nIgnores a portion of the enemy's physical resistance when using physical attacks.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Piercing</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nIgnores a portion of the enemy's defense and perfect guard when attacking.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Magic Attack</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nIncreases the damage dealt to enemies from magic attacks.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Physical Attack</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nIncreases the damage dealt to enemies with physical attacks.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Bonus Attack</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nYour bonus attack power. Increases damage dealt to enemies.

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Bonus Attack</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nYour bonus attack power. Increases damage dealt to enemies. Its efficiency increases with your weapon's tier. Has no effect when no weapon is equipped.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Weapon Attack</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nThe total attack power of your equipped gear. Increases the damage dealt to enemies.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Movement Speed</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nYour character's ground movement speed. 100% represents normal speed. Can be increased up to 170%.

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Luck</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nThe main attribute for Thieves and Assassins. Increases the physical attack of Wizards, Thieves, Assassins, and Heavy Gunners. Affects critical rate.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Intelligence</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nThe main attribute for Wizards, Priests, and Soul Binders. Increases magic attack and affects magic resistance.

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Dexterity</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nThe main attribute for Archers, Heavy Gunners, and Strikers. Increases the physical attack of Knights, Berserkers, Priests, Archers, Heavy Gunners, Assassins, Runeblades, Strikers, and Soul Binders. Affects physical resistance and accuracy.

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Strength</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nThe main attribute for Knights, Berserkers, and Runeblades. Increases the physical attack of Knights, Berserkers, Wizards, Priests, Archers, Thieves, Runeblades, Strikers, and Soul Binders. Affects physical resistance.

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Stamina</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nA resource representing your character's endurance. Once your stamina runs out, you won't be able to use action skills that consume stamina. The stamina bar has 6 parts, and each part has 20 units. Stamina naturally regenerates over time.

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Spirit</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nSpirit is a resource consumed by skills. Once it has been depleted, you will be unable to use skills. Spirit naturally regenerates over time.

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Health</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nRepresents your character's wellbeing. When your health reaches 0, you'll be stuck under a tombstone. Health naturally regenerates over time.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Critical Resistance</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nDecreases the probability of being hit by a critical hit.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Evasion</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nDetermines the chance to completely dodge an enemy attack. Affected by Luck.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Magic Resistance</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nFurther reduces the magic damage your character takes. Affected by Intelligence.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Physical Resistance</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nFurther reduces the physical damage your character takes. Affected by Strength and Dexterity.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Defense</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nReduces damage taken from enemies.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Critical Damage</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nDetermines how much a critical hit increases the damage of the attack.

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Critical Rate</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nDetermines the probability that an attack will land as a critical hit. Critical hits have their damage increased. Affected by Luck.</FONT>
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Accuracy</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nDetermines if your attacks will hit their target. Affected by Dexterity.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Attack Speed</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nReduces the time between regular attacks and the cast time for skills. Affected by Dexterity.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Magic Attack</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nDetermines the damage of magic attacks. Affected by Intelligence.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Physical Attack</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nThis main attribute determines the damage of physical attacks. Each job is affected by different attributes.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Luck</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nThis main attribute affects the Attack attribute of Thieves and Assassins.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Intelligence</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nThis main attribute affects the Attack attribute of Wizards, Priests, and Rune Blades.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Dexterity</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nThis main attribute affects the Attack attribute of Archers and Heavy Gunners.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Strength</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nThis main attribute affects the Attack attribute of Knights, Berserkers, and Runeblades.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Movement Speed (%)</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nYour character's ground movement speed. 100% represents normal speed. Can be increased up to 170%.

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Stamina</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>Resource necessary for using action skills. You cannot use action skills without sufficient stamina. Stamina regenerates naturally over time.

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Spirit</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nResource necessary for using active skills. You cannot use active skills without sufficient spirit. Spirit regenerates naturally over time.

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Health</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nYour character's health. Once it reaches zero, your character will be stuck under a tombstone and be unable to act. Health regenerates naturally over time.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Defense Score</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nYour character's overall defensive capability. Calculated using attributes such as defense and health.

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Attack Score</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>Your character's overall combat ability. Calculated using attributes such as weapon attack, physical attack, magic attack, critical rate, and critical damage.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Defense </FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nYour character's overall defensive capability. Affected by Defense attributes on your equipment.

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Attack</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>Your character's overall combat ability. Affected by weapon attack, physical attack, magic attack, critical rate, and critical damage.

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Gear Score</FONT>
<FONT size='3'> </FONT>This the sum of all gear score values from the gear your character currently has equipped. Gear score is a numerical representation of your equipment's power. Some dungeons have minimum gear score requirements, but greater rewards.

When dual-wielding weapons, only the weapon with the highest gear score will contribute to your total gear score. If the difference between your weapons' gear score is too great, your gear score will be penalized based on the difference.

Shields and codices do not contribute to your gear score.

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Gear Score</FONT>
<FONT size='3'> </FONT>This is the sum of all Gear Score values from the gear your character currently has equipped. Gear Score is a numerical representation of your equipment's power. Some dungeons have minimum Gear Score requirements, but greater rewards.

Please note that off-hand items do not contribute to your Gear Score. (Shields, codices, and one-handed weapons placed in the second weapon slot are all considered off-hand items.)
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Trophies</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nThe number of trophies your character has earned.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Chat Window Resize</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nChange the size of the chat window.

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Stamina</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nOnce your stamina runs out, you won't be able to use action skills that require stamina. The stamina bar has 6 parts which each represent 20 units. Stamina naturally regenerates over time.

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Spirit</FONT>

Spirit naturally regenerates over time.

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Dismantle Items</FONT>
<FONT size='3'> </FONT>
Gain useful materials by using a portable dismantler.
• Lv. 20+ Gear -> Onyx Crystals, Chaos Onyx Crystals
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Minimize Minimap</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nMinimize the minimap so it can't be seen. Pressing the button again will restore it.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Minimap Settings</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nSelect the information that will be shown on your minimap.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >World Map [M]</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nView the entire map of Maple World. The map also includes info on your current location and local monsters.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Switch Channel</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nGo to a different channel on the same server.

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Pet Skin</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nThe summoned pet's appearance is changed to that of the equipped Pet Skin. The pet's appearance and attack animation will be altered, but its attributes will remain unchanged.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Prestige Rank</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nYour prestige rank unlocks special account-wide lifestyle perks.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Effect Badge</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nGrants your character a visual effect.

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Auto-Gathering Badge</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nOnce gathering is initiated, it automatically continues until the success rate reaches zero. Usable for Mining, Foraging, Ranching, and Farming.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Fishing Accessories</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nChanges the appearance of your fishing pole and fishing chair.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Buddy Badge</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nTriggers a special visual effect in proximity of an adventurer with the paired badge.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Swim Tube</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nChanges the appearance of your swim tube.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Tombstone Style</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nChanges the appearance of your tombstone.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Name Tag</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nChanges your name tag.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Chat Bubble</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nChanges your chat bubbles.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Damage Font</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nChanges the font used to display your damage.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Transparency Badge</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nConfigurable to selectively hide equipped gear.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Level</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nYour character's level is a measure of their overall combat ability.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Badges</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nRight-click badges from your Badge inventory to equip them.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Gear</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nRight-click armor and accessories in the Equip tab of your inventory to equip them.
Quote of the Day Try writing something for your Quote of the Day to show your friends. You can enter your message here with a left click.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Set Portrait</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nSet your portrait by selecting an image on your computer or using the portrait camera to take a picture in-game.

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Spirit</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nSpirit is a resource consumed by your combat skills. Once your spirit has been depleted, you will be unable to use combat skills. Spirit naturally regenerates over time.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Health</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nThis is your character's health. If your health reaches zero, you will be stuck under a tombstone and unable to act.

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Architect Points</FONT>
<FONT size='3'> </FONT>
<FONT color='#8dd502'>This Month/Total Points</FONT>
People who visit your home can nominate you as a star architect. Nominations earn you architect points. These points contribute towards this month's points, which get reset each month, and the total points you've received during your time in Maple World. You can nominate one architect per day per account.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Job</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nYour character's job determines the role they fulfill and the abilities they can utilize.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Home</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nThis is the name of your home. All characters on an account share a single home.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Start Date</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nThis is the date your character began their adventure.

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15'>Possible Rewards</FONT>
<FONT size='3'> </FONT>Possible rewards found at the end of this challenge. Your actual rewards are chosen at random.

Some rewards may be contained within selection boxes.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Last Page</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nGo to the last page.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Next Batch</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nMove to the next group of pages.
<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Previous Batch</FONT>\n<FONT size='3'> </FONT>\nMove to the previous set of pages.

<FONT color='#FFD200' size='15' >Filter Similar Levels</FONT>\nCheck this box to only display quests that are appropriate for your level. \nUncheck the box to display quests with recommended levels that are 5 or more levels lower than your current level.
